title: Understanding Non-Bizarre Delusions
text: Non-bizarre delusions are false beliefs that are plausible but not true. They are different from bizarre delusions, which are strange and unrealistic.

title: Characteristics of Non-Bizarre Delusions
text: These delusions involve situations that could occur in real life, such as being followed or having a disease, but are not true.

hintAnswer: a fixed false belief containing content that is plausible but inconsistent with evidence
title: Identifying Non-Bizarre Delusions
text: Which of the following best describes a non-bizarre delusion?
choices: a fixed false belief that cannot be changed in the mind of those who hold them despite evidence to the contrary
fixed false beliefs with content that is not reasonably possible in this world. They are strange, eccentric, and unrealistic
a fixed false belief containing content that is plausible but inconsistent with evidence
the perception of sensory experiences without natural external stimuli
